isis.stitle: ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CATERPILLAR 3176 - 1992 - 1993 - TROUBLESHOOTING - INSPECTING ELECTRICAL CONNECTORS

svcsubproc.title: Visual Inspection
svcsubproc.para: The troubleshooting guides require checking specific connectors. Use the following steps to determine if the connector is causing the problem. If a problem is found, repair the connector and continue the process.

item.para: Check Connector Lock Mechanism Or Retaining Screw. Make sure the con- nector is capable of properly locking the connector together.

Perform 10 Pound Pull Test On Each Terminal/Wire In Connector. Each terminal/wire should easily withstand 10 pounds of pull and remain in the connector. This test checks whether the wire was properly crimped in the terminal, and whether the pin was properly inserted into the connector. Repair as needed.
Visually Inspect Wiring. Look for worn or damaged wires. Check for pinched or damaged harnesses.
Visually Inspect Connectors. Verify that pins and sockets are not corroded, damaged or dirty. Verify correct align- ment and location of terminals in the connector.

Check Individual Pins And Sockets. This is especially important for intermittent problems. Using a new pin (1651968C91), insert the pin into each socket, one at a time, checking for a good grip on the pin by the socket. Repeat for each pin on the mating side of the connector, using a new socket (1651969C91) for the test.

svcsubproc.title: Performing Electrical Tests At OEM Connector To ECM
svcsubproc.para: International engine harness ECM connector (320) mates with Caterpillar engine harness connector J7. The connector is a 40-pin Deutsch connector, with the International side having sockets (female terminal) and the Caterpillar side having pins. No tests in this manual require testing "into" the Caterpillar J7 connector.

When testing at the International side of the Deutsch connector, never insert meter probes into the sockets, as they will damage the connector.
Always use test leads of the type described in paragraph Test Leads of this manual. The test leads must fit tightly into the terminal sockets, without expanding the terminal.

svcsubproc.title: Test Leads
svcsubproc.para: To construct test leads, attach an insulated alligator clip to a suitable length of 16 gauge wire. On the other end, use Deutsch HDT-48-00 Crimping Tool to crimp a male terminal (pin), International part number 1651958C1.

svcsubproc.title: Replacing International Components
svcsubproc.para: When replacing electrical switches, connectors (including pins or sockets), relays or other components, use only approved International replacement parts. Many of the switches have gold or silver plated contacts and some of the connectors include gold plated terminals. By using correct replacement parts, you maintain the design integrity of the system.
